name: Mayo-Free Chicken Salad With Kimchi, Ginger, and Scallions
description: Mixing mayonnaise into chicken salad is the most common way to add moisture, but it's not the only way. Vinaigrette works well too, like this tangy Korean-inspired rendition with kimchi, pine nuts, and lots of fresh ginger.
recipeYield: Makes about 8 cups of chicken salad, serving 8 as a small side or sandwich
recipeIngredient: 4 cups shredded cooked chicken meat (from about a 3-pound roast chicken)
1/4 cup toasted pine nuts or sesame seeds
1/4 cup thinly sliced scallion, white and light green parts only (about 2 scalions)
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
Sliced bread and frisee, if serving as a sandwich

recipeInstructions.text: In a large bowl, toss together all ingredients to combine thoroughly. Season with salt and pepper and serve as a light salad or on bread as a sandwich. Salad can be refrigerated in an airtight container overnight.
